This guide is a simplified overview of all the changes in the [[Update Aquatic]] (Phase Two) ({{BE}} 1.5.x releases), which assumes at least some familiarity with the Update Aquatic (Phase One) (''Bedrock Edition'' 1.4.x releases).

==Mobs==
===New===
{|{{Simple Guide table|New Mobs}} 
|-
|[[Turtle]]
|[[File:Turtle.png|184px]]
|Any beaches except for cold beaches
|
{{drop|1=Block|2=Seagrass|3=0|4=1}}
* {{xp|1|3}} (when killed by a [[player]] or tamed [[wolf]])
|
* Turtles can be bred with [[seagrass]]. After mating, one turtle travels back to its home beach to lay its eggs, regardless of the distance.
* Baby turtles drop one [[turtle scute|scute]] when they grow into an adult.
|}

===Changed===
{|{{Simple Guide table|Changed Mobs}} 
|-
|[[Undead]] mobs
|
|Now sink in water and can walk on the bottom.
|-
|[[Dolphin]]
|[[File:Dolphin.png|128px]]
|Can now be given [[raw cod]] or [[raw salmon]] and will swim towards the nearest ocean ruins or shipwreck.
|-
|[[Drowned]]
|[[File:Drowned.png|128px]]
|
* Now have a chance to spawn with a nautilus shell.
* Are no longer only available through [[experimental gameplay]].
|-
|[[Husk]], <br>[[zombie]]
|{{Animate|Husk.png;Zombie_JE2_BE1.png|128px}}
|If the husks are sunk in water, they can now transform into zombies and then into drowned.
|-
|[[Skeleton horse]]
|[[File:Skeleton_Horse_17w45a.png|128px]]
|Can now be ridden underwater.
|-
|[[Skeleton]], <br>[[stray]]
|{{Animate|Skeleton_JE5_BE3.png;Stray BE2.png|128px}}
|Will now switch from ranged to melee attacks while underwater and switch back when out of water.
|}

==Blocks==
===New===
{|{{Simple Guide table|New Blocks}} 
|-
|[[Conduit]]
|[[File:Conduit.png|84px]]
|
{{Crafting|A1 = Nautilus Shell|B1 = Nautilus Shell|C1 = Nautilus Shell|A2 = Nautilus Shell|B2 = Heart of the Sea|C2 = Nautilus Shell|A3 = Nautilus Shell|B3 = Nautilus Shell|C3 = Nautilus Shell|Output = Conduit|type = TileEntity}}
|Any
|Conduits give the [[conduit power]] status effect when powered.
|-
|[[Turtle egg]]s
|
{{animate|Turtle Egg 1 JE1.png;Turtle Egg 2 JE1.png;Turtle Egg 3 JE1.png;Turtle Egg 4 JE1.png|84px}}{{verify|whether these models are accurate to those used in Bedrock Edition upon the introduction of turtle eggs will need to be investigated}}
|Can be obtained by breeding two [[turtle]]s
|Any (only drops with [[Silk Touch]])
|
* Can be used as a decorative block.
* Hatches into baby turtles.
|-
|[[Bubble column]]
|[[File:Bubble Column JE1 BE1.png|84px]]
|Created by magma blocks and soul sand placed underwater.
|N/A
|
* Bubble columns produced by magma blocks pull entities downwards.
* Bubble columns produced by soul sand push entities upwards.
|}

{|{{Simple Guide table|Changed Blocks}}

|[[Blue ice]] 
|[[File:Blue Ice JE1 BE1.png|84px]]

|[[Coral]]s

==Items==
===New===
{|{{Simple Guide table|New Items}} 
|-
|[[Turtle Scute|Scute]]
|[[file:Scute JE1 BE1.png|84px]] 
|Dropped by baby [[turtle]]s when growing into an adult.
|Can be used to craft a [[turtle shell]].
|-
|[[Turtle shell]]
|[[file:Turtle Shell.png|84px]]
|
{{Crafting|A1=Turtle Scute|B1=Turtle Scute|C1=Turtle Scute|A2=Turtle Scute|C2=Turtle Scute|Output=Turtle Shell}}
|
* Can be worn as a helm, provides ten seconds of [[water breathing]] while the player is out of water or in a [[bubble column]], which starts counting down when the player goeset.
* When worn underwater.
* Can be brewed into [[potion of the turtle master]].
|-
|Turtle [[spawn egg]]
|[[File:Turtle Spawn Egg JE1 BE1.png|84px]]
|Obtained from the creative inventory.
|Can be used to spawn the respective mob.
|}
